intro: Phyllarthron thouarsianum, commonly known as the Madagascar starleaf, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that are often brightly colored. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
